Comment: To be clear... the rumor regarding kids identifying as cats and using litter boxes had nothing to do with the use of an emergency bucket during lockdowns.  The litter box rumor was nothing but a lie with very little basis in reality.  The two became connected when a journalist began looking for actual proof to support the lie about litter boxes and the only litter box adjacent usage the journalist found was one school district (the one where Columbine is located) had emergency go boxes for school lockdowns.  I point this out because I do not want to give any wiggle room for a person who has spread the litter box lie to claim that they were just mistaken about the use of an emergency bucket.  They weren't mistaken, they were intentionally lying in order to mock trans people and to harm the reputation(s) of public schools.
Author: WhatRUHourly

Comment: It is a limitation of freedoms and can be harmful to children.  For instance, my daughter is in 2nd grade.  In her elementary school there is a child who is special needs.  Every day that child wears a pink animal tail and some sort of ears.  I do not know why the child wears this attire every day, but I have seen nothing from them to indicate that it is because they believe they are a pink cat and I certainly don't think a special needs 8 year old is doing it out of some sexual desire.  I imagine that these things make the child comfortable and are coping type devices for the child and are beneficial to them in helping them feel safe and comfortable in the school.  So, should this child be banned from wearing this attire because of some stupid right-wing lie and conspiracy?  Should they be expelled from public school despite it not being a distraction or an issue at all?  I had a classmate years ago that would bark at other people.  He also was a bit special needs and it was a coping mechanism for him because of social awkwardness.  He in no way believed himself to be a dog and was not really pretending to be a dog, he was merely barking, usually in the hallways when being picked on.  Should he have been expelled because he was making a noise the Texas GOP doesn't approve of?
Author: WhatRUHourly

Comment: There's signs that the list was generated by AI.   For example, It removed the whole Datura genus, but then listed an outdated name a specific Datura species further down.   There were two spots where it used a WILDLY outdated latin name for a species, which hasn't been in normal use for decades.   It's also not in any particular order - Not alphabetical, or grouped by genus.   It included banning the entire Stropharia genus, but those mushrooms are ENTIRELY harmless. Like, it includes Wine Cap mushrooms. Other 'non-edible' species in the genus are just unpalatable, they won't kill you.
